title: The lovable (and lethal) sea lion - Claire Simeone

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the key physical adaptations that enables sea lions to hunt for up to 30 hours at a time?

options.label: A
options.text: Their ability to see in the dark

options.label: B
options.text: Their rounder lens and teardrop-shaped pupils

options.label: C
options.text: Their collapsible rib cage and springy lungs

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of sea lions' whiskers, or vibrissae?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect the presence of predators

options.label: B
options.text: To sense the slim trails of moving water fish

options.label: C
options.text: To detect changes in water temperature

options.label: D
options.text: To communicate with other sea lions

multiple-choice.question: How do sea lions' eyes adapt to see in deep water?

options.label: A
options.text: By having a more curved lens

options.label: B
options.text: By having a rounder lens and teardrop-shaped pupils

options.label: D
options.text: By having a more sensitive retina

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the ways that climate change is affecting sea lions?

options.label: A
options.text: By reducing the availability of their prey

options.label: B
options.text: By increasing the temperature of the water

options.label: C
options.text: By causing toxic algae to bloom year-round

options.label: D
options.text: By reducing the amount of sunlight that reaches the ocean

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the benefits of studying sea lions and their adaptations?

options.label: A
options.text: To learn more about the impact of climate change on terrestrial animal communities

multiple-choice.question: How do sea lions remember multiple hunting grounds?

options.label: B
options.text: By relying on their sense of smell

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the ways that sea lions communicate with each other?
What is one of the challenges facing sea lions due to climate change?

options.label: B
options.text: The reduction of their prey population

options.label: C
options.text: The increase in the amount of sunlight that reaches the ocean

options.label: D
options.text: The increase in the temperature of the water

multiple-choice.question: How do sea lions adapt to the pressure of deep water?

options.label: A
options.text: By collapsing their rib cage and compressing their lungs

options.label: B
options.text: By expanding their lungs and increasing their oxygen intake

options.label: C
options.text: By reducing their heart rate and conserving energy

options.label: D
options.text: By increasing their muscle mass and strength

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the benefits of studying the behavior of sea lions in the wild?

options.label: A
options.text: To learn more about the impact of climate change on terrestrial animal communities
